item.title: Chartbook #72: Team Transitory Roars Back
item.description:
After the record series of “prints” for US CPI inflation in October, November and December 2021, there was a sense that the balance of policy argument had shifted. Inflation could no longer be dismissed as a temporary aberration. “Team transitory” and “team sectoral” were on the ropes…

URL: https://adamtooze.substack.com/p/chartbook-72-team-transitory-roars?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Walking the Dog in the Suburbs of Omelas

item.title: Why I hate cryptocurrency
item.description:
Play stupid games, win stupid prizes: Cryptocurrency values are way down over the last couple of months, but who’s to say whether the new prices or the old prices are right? Crypto markets aren’t like normal financial markets where the price is supposed to tell you something useful about the real economy…

URL: https://www.joshbarro.com/p/why-i-hate-cryptocurrency?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Walking the Dog in the Suburbs of Omelas

item.title: The Fed looks increasingly determined to make a major policy error
item.description:
Making monetary policy is hard, and I sympathize with officials at the Fed who have to make very difficult and very consequential decisions under extreme uncertainty. As someone with pretty dovish views on what policy ought to be now, I have to acknowledge that the Fed remained very patient in 2021 even as inflation rose well above its target and despit…

URL: https://ryanavent.substack.com/p/the-fed-looks-increasingly-determined?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Walking the Dog in the Suburbs of Omelas

item.title: It's all relative
item.description:
The Bank for International Settlements produces some of the most interesting macro research of any global institution. And whilst I don’t always agree with it, I usually find it interesting. This week the VoxEU write-up of a recent paper on inflation…

URL: https://duncanweldon.substack.com/p/its-all-relative?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Walking the Dog in the Suburbs of Omelas
